page.title: 10THE HOLDERNESS DIARY
page.content: The Diary was started in 1983 as a hobby for Mr. and Mrs. P.B.Smith. The Diary was never meant to be too much like a newspaper. It is more for local interest and includes a Diary of Local Events. They particularly avoid printing BAD news. The Holderness Diary is designed, typed and prepared at 17 Kissing Gate, Burton Pidsea. The Smiths do practically all the work themselves, apart from the printing and they find the work very absorbing. They spend a lot of time collecting information and reading articles at the Local History Library. As soon as one issue is complete work begins on the next one. Local businesses help to finance the Diary by paying for advertising, although classified advertisements are free. 2000 copies are given away free each month.
